HERO.HEADING: Secure, web-based AI tools for all your language research projects
HERO.SUBHEADING: Custom wearable language loggers, secure cloud storage, and a web app for using AI to process and analyze your language files

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: The Echolalia Project aims to promote data collection, sharing, and analyzing of behavioral data to study language development in infants. The project focuses on creating community-improved, open-source, state-of-the-art Machine Learning tools to securely store, manage, analyze and share daylong audio and related data while respecting the privacy of the families.

This project rests on an international network of researchers in Europe, America and Asia. It's operational quarters are currently at the Ecole Normale Sup√©rieure in Paris. It has been funded by CNR, INRIA, NSF, ANR, MSR, Facebook and Amazon.

LOGGER.TITLE: Baby Logger
LOGGER.INFO: A small, user-friendly, baby-compatible, wearable audio recorder. It has 4 channels, an accelerometer, 24 hours of recording autonomy, stores up to 120h of data and is encrypted. With the logger comes a set of tools to extract and decrypt the data.

PORTAL.TITLE: Researcher Portal
PORTAL.INFO: A cloud platform for annotating, analyzing and archiving audio data with secure state-of-the-art machine learning tools (signal processing, speech recognition). The data is stored encrypted, the analysis is performed in the cloud itself and can be securely shared and analyzed in situ insuring end-to-end privacy.

DISTRIBUTION.TITLE: We distribute these components in two ways:

ONE.TITLE: Open source code and hardware
ONE.INFO: Both the BabyLogger schematics and code, and the modules of the ResearcherPortal are open source and can be reproduced and modified (MIT open source license, see our GitHub). Contributors are welcome.

TWO.TITLE: Ready to use devices and web service
TWO.INFO: We have setup a non-profit (Echolalia-NP) which distributes at the lowest possible cost, but without putting a non-sustainable burden on the research labs contributing to this project, the Echolalia components for the non-technical savy behavioral scientist. It helps researchers group order BabyLoggers in order to lower the construction price, gives them access to an on-line version of the ResearcherPortal running on a local GDPR-compliant cloud in Europe, and some customer support.

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: During their first years of life, infants develop physically, emotionally and cognitively at an amazing speed.
These early acquisitions lay the foundation for later academic, personal and professional achievements.
Echolalia helps your family and your child, to make the most of this critical developmental period.
Echolalia is a mobile application that documents, tracks, and helps to improve upon your child‚Äôs natural development.
We use cutting-edge technology in AI and cognitive sciences to analyze your child's learning path and propose personalized content to activate his full potential.
We have designed Echolalia to use the highest cyber security standards available proposed by the biggest institutions in the world (CNIL, MIT, American army) to protect your privacy.
Our security system is regularly tested by third parties to insure and protect your privacy.

MAIN.TITLE: Our Mission
MAIN.SUBTITLE: Promote collection and analysis of behavioral data for the purpose of behavioral data in order to:
MAIN.ONE: contribute to fundamental research on cognitive development and functioning
MAIN.TWO: contribute to applied research aimed at solving major societal challenges (well-being, education, health, etc.)

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: We help data collection through the building or improvement of secure wearable devices (audio, physiological, images, etc) that enable daylong recording of human interactions and activities in their 'ecological' environments. We help analysis through the development or improvement of annotation software and machine learning algorithms that can be applied at scale in these data. Both sets of technologies are build according to open science and privacy-by-design principles to ensure both maximum reusability, sharability and replicability of the scientific findings and maximum privacy and confidentiality of the participants' data.

ONE.TITLE: Interdisciplinarity
ONE.INFO: We believe that behavioral research and machine learning are engaged in a synergistic, interdisciplinary, collaborative relationship which is going to bring incredible societal and scientific value for education, health and well being, when done right. We strive to help this relationship in the particular instance of early cognitive development, but believe that our model can be exported for other areas of behavioral studies.

TWO.TITLE: Open Science
TWO.INFO: We believe in open, transparent, reproducible, and collaborative science both for data and for algorithms, as is demultiplies the spread of scientific knowledge and its impact on real life problems. This is why we open source all of our tools, and build technology to share data or models across researchers in a secure fashion.

THREE.TITLE: Privacy by Design
THREE.INFO: We believe that parents, families, children, communities participating in behavioral studies should be considered as stakeholders of the process of making scientific progress and therefore treated as partners. This is why, while we build tools to increase data collection volume  and depth of analysis through AI, we counterbalance this  by strenghtening privacy protection and empowering participants with control and insight over their own data.

DESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: The Laboratory of Cognitive and Psycholinguistic Sciences (LSCP) is located in Paris in the Department of Cognitive Studies of the √âcole Normale Sup√©rieure. The goal of research at LSCP is to understand the psychological mechanisms that underlie the acquisition and functioning of typically human cognitive functions, such as language, social cognition and consciousness.

Integrated into the LSCP, the goal of the Cognitive Machine Learning (CoML) team is to reverse engineer these human capacities, that is to say to develop algorithms that can reproduce certain aspects and test their validity as models of human cognition. The team's activities are centered on speech, language and reasoning.

JOBDESCRIPTION.PARAGRAPH: We're hiring for Echolalia! Our Echolalia team is responsible for managing our releases and environments, monitoring/alerting, CI/CD pipelines, packaging and integration technologies for delivery our product to our customers, and developer ergonomics. As a member of this team, you'll own the process of bundling our application into a fault-tolerant deliverable that can interact with a multitude of client environments, all while using modern DevOps technologies and processes.

The role of the recruited engineer will be to contribute to the design and ergonomic optimization of the existing application. He / she will be in charge of the visual identity of the application through the graphic charter, the creation and the layout of the graphic elements and the user experience (UX).

ROLE.PARAGRAPH: Creation of websites, landing pages, themes, email templates, checkout flows, billing UI. Designing and building many of our most public facing properties. The visual voice of the company.
Working with design and marketing teams to define, evolve, and maintain Ghost's brand identity across all marketing and product touch points.
Working with the marketing/business team on projects which are directly related to growing the business and creating user-facing content.
We work on cross-functional product teams of 2-5 people, usually one designer and a few developers.

Lots of freedom to take control of your process, iterating and learning what works (and what doesn't), and putting your work into production. There's a lot of opportunity for professional growth here, as the team expands.
Communicating effectively with stakeholders when presenting your work and clearly articulating your design rationale
Managing multiple projects, while setting appropriate expectations and meeting realistic deadlines

CANDIDATE.PARAGRAPH: Echolalia is a software company, and everyone here codes in one way or another. You'll need to be comfortable with coding your designs in modern HTML & CSS.

All teams at Echolalia operate fairly autonomously, and all team members are responsible for helping make decisions about what needs to be done. You'll need to be comfortable ideating, prototyping, testing and delivering designs without someone standing over your shoulder telling you what to do.

Despite frequent character assassination amongst UX professionals, aesthetic style matters a great deal. We don't A/B test 50 shades of blue here to determine what converts best, we care about making beautiful things which we love.
We like smart people who have lots of ideas, yet are happy to discard their former opinions whenever a better way of doing things presents itself.
Good design is good communication, and as a remote team which communicates almost exclusively through writing ‚Äî concise, written communication is absolutely essential to this role.

We look for people who actively want critical feedback on their work early and often, and who get a kick out of refining and pushing what they do as a collaborative process because it creates a better end result. No design heroes.
